November 5, 2024 Consolidated General Election Want to map out your voting plan, read/listen to your Voter Information Pamphlet, track your ballot, learn about election security, and more? Visit the Election Readiness Toolkit Register to vote Learn about voter eligibility, how to register to vote, and special cases. Voter Portal Check your ballot status, party preference, and request election materials. Ranked-Choice Voting Learn when and how we use this voting method. Services Registration Register to vote You can register online or on paper. Update your voter registration Make changes to the information in your voter registration record. Non-citizen voting rights in local Board of Education elections Current local law allows certain non-citizens to vote in San Francisco’s Board of Education (School Board) elections. Voting Ways to vote You can choose to cast your ballot by mail or in person. Vote in person You can vote at a polling place or at the Voting Center. Vote by mail We now mail a ballot to every local voter in every election. Voting by mail is convenient and secure. New voters Find out how to register and vote if you are a first-time voter in San Francisco. Language access You can get voting materials and ask for help in your language. Accessible voting Learn about resources we offer to ensure all voters can vote with ease. Campaigns, candidates, and observers Candidates Our office serves candidates for all local offices. Measures and ballot arguments San Francisco voters decide many issues through ballot measures. Election observation Members of the public are welcome to observe election processes. Get involved Serve as a poll worker Help your community and earn up to $295 by serving as a poll worker on Election Day! Voter outreach We help local residents understand the voting process. Host a polling place Help your community and earn a stipend by hosting a polling place on Election Day! High school student programs Not quite old enough to vote? You can still play a part in elections! Ballot Simplification Committee process Learn about how the Committee works and how to participate Voter Information Pamphlet delivery options By law we must mail a pamphlet to every voter, unless they opt out of postal delivery. Data View and download data sets. Maps View maps of the city's voting sites and districts. Your voting districts and representatives Look up your voting districts and find out who represents you. Future elections View a list of upcoming elections in San Francisco. Historical voter turnout View historical voter turnout going back to 1899. Find past Voter Information Pamphlets See past Voter Information Pamphlets as far back as 1907. Forms Forms for voters, candidates, and campaigns View archived San Francisco Elections website View our website as it previously appeared. This archive was captured in April 2023. Ranked-choice voting Learn when and how we use this voting method. Election Security The City and County of San Francisco takes election security very seriously. We have the strongest voting security standards in the country. Learn about how we protect elections. About Our mission is to provide equitable access to voting and election-related services and to conduct free, fair, and functional elections for the City and County of San Francisco.
